history.text: Hey there... I thought this was a fairly good movie
Did you like it?
Yes I did.  Steven Spielberg usually directs interesting films.
I thought it was rated pretty accurately as well.
What do you think of the critical response about him not taking his characters seriously?
I tend to enjoy less serious movies so I did not mind that.  I felt the "bogged down" comment was a bit harsh however
yes, me too. It was an interesting enough story to keep me entertained.
And it was true?!
Agreed. If I'm watching a movie and not enjoying, I tend to not finish it rather than wasting the two hours of my time.  HA
exactly. shouldn't we be advancing to the next script by now? lol
Great characters and actors ;)
I was just going to say I felt they had quite a few well known names in the cast list.
I don't remember Christopher Walken being in it. I need to watch it again.
It lists Martin Sheen on there

I tend to not rewatch movies for whatever reason unless a decent amount of time goes between.  Unless it was a very captivating movie.  This one however I would consider just to try and pick up on more details.
Always interesting to see how people "pull things off". Like how in the world could somebody get away with stealing so much money!
Yes.. it looks like the document changed ... Do you remember him posing as a substitute teacher?
I recognize the name Martin Sheen but I wouldn't recognize him.
He's more in 80's and 90's movies.
I do not remember that but did find the airline pilot impersonation rather amusing.
Yes, me too.
Some people can pull stuff like that off. Especially when they do not allow fear to butt in
Ah before my time.
I really need to rewatch this movie. I don't remember when he returned home to his mother being with another man.
I'd be way to scared to try stuff like that.  And escaping from a plane - not in my skill list.
I do - but I can't imagine how that would feel in Real life.  Sound like his younger years were quite troubling for a kid
wow..it's amazing he was able to pull that off as well as gain a lucrative career from it
At least things seemed to work out in the end for him.
yeah... he was brilliant from it all

from the credits it sounds as if 
He got to go on to have a, what seems to be, happy marriage and children
he was pretty much a good guy trapped in bad circumstances. It's nice he was able to lead an honest life afterwards
For sure.  His past seems to show how hard it was to start off good.
It was nice chatting with you about this movie
Yes you as well.
